website_summaries.verdict: If you want one machine with multiple lawn care functions, this is one to buy. Heavier than other models, but offers power and better control.
pros: Powerful engine cuts through thick growth
Many attachment options, such as edger and tiller
cons: May release too much line when bumped

customer_reviews.title: How did this get 4 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't stay on. Starts up fine. Just keeps dying after a little use. Can't keep the throttle open. This is my second time using the thing, but not my first time using a weed whacker or other small engines. Followed all instructions. Used gas and oil in the right ratios. My friend has the same issue and same model. Checked online and this seems to be a common issue. When it's cold it works good for a few seconds then I have to keep feathering it so it stays on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew John Close

customer_reviews.title: so good. Serious power that gets through thick grass
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Serious power that gets through thick grass. When long grass wraps around the head, it doesn't prevent continuing work until you want to remove that grass. In other words, the grass can't wrap in such a way to slow the head down. This is good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Most Powerful I've Used
customer_reviews.text: Best, most powerful trimmer I have ever had. You can add attachments but this is a 128LD (made for mass market stores / designed to accept a variety of brand attachments) so the attachments are actually made by Poulan. The 128LDX uses Husqvarna attachments. Using Echo trim line that is less expensive than Husqvarna's..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Weedwacker!
customer_reviews.text: Love this weedwacker! We have gone thru so many weedwackers over the years and this seems like the best built one. Never seems to stall. Pretty light. Doesn't seem to eat up weedwacker line as quickly as others. And easier to install weedwacker line. This might be our new go to company for all our yard equipment needs.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlie

customer_reviews.title: The best trimmer I have ever owned !
customer_reviews.text: Assembled easily. Started on the 2nd pull, and has run, flawlessly, the first day. 50:1 oil mix (it already has its own gas can, labeled: string trimmer 50:1 - just so I don't forget and use the can for my Husqvarna chain saw). Plenty of power for deep grass, although it bogged down a few times. Time will tell, if it lets me down. But I have a good feeling about this one. Beats the Ryobi tap-and-go, hands down
customer_reviews.author: Howard Walker

customer_reviews.title: This is poor quality.  Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Read the one and two star reviews and you will discover some major motor problems. We bought this trimmer to use with a brush cutter attachment, but the attachment burns up some parts on the motor. When we tried to return it to Amazon...they wouldn't even take it back! Even they know it's junk.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Petersen

customer_reviews.title: 3 weeks and it's broken!
customer_reviews.text: Not even a month and it broke! I bought Husqvarna oil and I took good care of it. I am so upset that I am writing my first review ever on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Saintardvaliente

customer_reviews.title: Good machine.  Behaves well and eats like a beast.
customer_reviews.text: Good machine. The choke switch being on the inside makes for accidental turning off but it otherwise starts right back up. Just a bit inconvenient when I'm on a roll and the switch brushes up against my clothes and turns it off. But for the price I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: sandra dillon

customer_reviews.title: Product will not run when choke is not on.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was very easy, the line was nice and thick. I was happy until I tried to get the machine running. Followed the directions and was easily able to get it going on half choke. Every time I tried to throttle up it dies instantly . Yes I am using the correct mixture. Would NEVER recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Pull cord broke on 3rd pull - Required $50 service fee from service center to diagnose
customer_reviews.text: Brand new and on first use, the pull cord broke on 3rd pull. Called the service center who gave me a number to an authorized repairer that wanted $50 for a diagnostic fee on a brand new string trimmer with a broken pull cord. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Al . A

customer_reviews.title: Terrible/won’t even run!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst purchase we’ve ever made. This thing won’t run. Period. I should have checked it when it came in and returned it but we had too much going on so it’s sat in the basement for nearly a year. Just don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Best trimmer I've ever owned. I had a Toro for about 12 years before this one. It was very finicky. You had to have the magic touch to get it to start. This one is a breeze. I just mixed the fuel in accordance with the directions (50:1, as I recall), primed it, choked it, and it started right up. One great feature is the three-position choke. One for starting, one for warming up, and one for after it's been operating for a few minutes. Very powerful and responsive to throttle position.
customer_reviews.author: RegularJimTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Defective. Advertised to be 11 lbs. without gas. So heavy shipper had put a warning label on it. Difficult to start, but ran until string was gone, then would not advance. Reloaded, ran until string gone, no advance. Extremely difficult to restart and now will not run more than a minute.
customer_reviews.author: V. T. H.

customer_reviews.title: Husky never lets me down
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this unit. I own one Husk Weedeater that only can be used as a string trimmer it always starts. I was in need of unit with blade capability and kept coming back to this unit. After researching many brands, including Sthil at a much higher cost I opted to try this unit out. I purchased the BC720 brush cutter attachment along with this unit. The brush cutter works great on briars and saplings up to about 1/4 dia. Easy to exchange and swap between this and the string trimmer. The string trimmer works excellently as expected. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Not a good start..
customer_reviews.text: Well, took it out of the box and found a wing nut is missing. Sealed bag contained screw, allen wrench, and no wing nut. Saw the Husqvarna had Saturday hours (see attached pictured,) called, and received a "Please call back Monday through Friday" message. Great! More to come...
customer_reviews.author: S. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: very happy purchase
customer_reviews.text: great machine. attached some very large weeds and grass, no problem! Easy assembly. Was a little worried about the package for shipping, all most no padding. Nothing damaged.A little heaver than the John Deere it replaced. Much more power,love the string head so easy to replace the trimmer string.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Early Failure
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed this product soon after I purchased it. I really liked it and gave it a stellar review. That was 16 months ago. It did not last. The unit has become hard to start and today the pull cord broke. I do not use the product very much – it been started less than 20 times. The pull cord should not have broken. Note I winterize all my equipment and keep them well maintenanced. I have experience with only one other Husqvarna product (a chain saw). It too failed early. I love the features of the weed eater but it seems Husqvarna does not make quality, lasting products.
customer_reviews.author: John S McSpadden

customer_reviews.title: good quality and powerful
customer_reviews.text: After years of using hand-me-down string trimmers I finally had enough. I live in a wooded area with a lot of underbrush that requires regular trimming. Typical cheaper trimmers just could not handle the dense growth. I purchased this trimmer and though I have only used it twice - the difference is amazing. The quality is excellent and it is very powerful, as you'd expect from Husqvarna, but the option to use add-ons like hedge trimmers and edgers from other manufacturers makes this the best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but my biggest issue is the blade string not ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but my biggest issue is the blade string not discharging and having to retract out the string manually
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G. Herold

customer_reviews.title: decent trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I purchased. Purchased the first a year ago and used the heck out of it. I live on an acreage, so I have a lot of trimming and not easy trimming like a suburban home. It has to go thru a lot of thick weeds. Doesn't get clogged that easy and seems to have plenty of power. Worked so good, I purchased a 2nd unit for our lake home.
customer_reviews.author: tgwiz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in July 2018, and like others have stated the carb does indeed need a small adjustment. It will run without doing it, but out of the box it runs lean. With the choke in the run position it will die if you do not give it a little throttle. Other than that, its been great so far. The detachable shaft is a revelation. You get this, and over time add the other attachments, and you can take on just about anything if your clearing your property. If you buy this, get the carb adjustment tool others have talked about. Its very cheap, and a few seconds after using it, your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: DaveC

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a broken muffler cover.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been happy with husqvarna products. I ordered a new weedeater to replace my 11-year-old version that finally met its demise after more than 2000 hours of use. Very happy with the product I’m sure this one will work just as well, but the muffler cover which is just plastic arrived cracked and broken. Called Husqvarna And they told me to contact Amazon. Amazon has given me no response. I’ll buy the $12 replacement piece and put it on but I don’t think it’s a good way to do business.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I read a ton of reviews on trimmers before i bought this one. Stop reading and just buy this Trimmer! Best trimmer I've ever owned! Easy to start, ton of power, and the line feed is awesome. I went through 3 trimmers in the last 5 years on my 100 acre land and nothing came close to this trimmer. The old saying that you get what you pay for is true with this also, $199 is a great deal for the quality and performance you get with the Husqvarna 128LD.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Goodpasture

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for trimming around my yard. Easy to assemble and started without any problems. Started trimming and about 10 mins later the engine quit. I tried to restart but discovered the engine had seized. The proper fuel mixture (50:1) was being used. I own several Husqvarna products and was both surprised and disappointed with the lack of quality control. I contacted Amazon who promptly sent a replacement. We’ll see how the new one performs, I’m not overly confident but will update.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Great string trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power to whack (or eat) those weeds. Straight shaft means it can handle attachments. Bump head to release new string is easy to use. Very simple to get it set up and simple to start. I haven't needed to tweak is carburetor from the factory settings. Can be a little thirsty if you run it hard. Fuel is pretty easy to mix, just buy a 2 or 5 gallon container, fill it with exactly that much gas, and then add in oil on a 50:1 ratio. Done!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Bought one and then I bought two more.
customer_reviews.text: I love my trimmer that I bought two more , but from eBay . Now (Fall 2019) they cost more and can not ship to Hawaii . I love using .80 string and cut grass like butter. I use many attachments , leaf blower, brush cutter, brush saw , and 8’ chain saw attachment. They are not heavy-duty to cut 8” trees ,but small branches with ease. One of my Husqvarna trimmer attachment fitting that attach the attachments got lose from abusing it with thick bush. Would buy a fourth , but my third Husqvarna trimmers are still going due to TLC.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: This is a well balanced, lite, good quality trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Update January 2020. I have purchased several attachments for this trimmer and I still recommend it, I have purchased the snowblower attachment and the edger attachment and this motor has had plenty of power to operate both. original review July 2017. This is a nice powerful trimmer, usually starts on the second pull. I like that you can purchase the other attachments for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna weed eater work great
customer_reviews.text: The Husqvarna weed eater work great. I am very satisfied with the product. Only thing I don't like is that I have to pull the starting cord four or five, perhaps six times before it will stat but it run great and trims grass and weed great.
customer_reviews.author: Billy J Short

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to start
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this before I moved into my new property almost 3 years ago. This is the third growing season I've had this product on 5 acres of land with a large number of trees. I purchased the blower, the edger, and the chainsaw attachment. I prune at least twice a year and have put a very HEAVY demand on this product. It's done very well and is still running like a sewing machine. Strongly recommend this if you are looking for a trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Vitamin J

customer_reviews.title: Junk Junk Junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Had to remove feed hub twice in first 10 minutes to restring. Wouldn't idle after 20 minutes. Wouldn't stay running at all after 30 minutes. YeS I KnoW hOw 2CyclE eNgIneS wOrk. Product support is non existent. No way to contact manufacturer other than waiting on the phone for hours. Sorry you don't get 2 chances. If you can't QC your product, that's on you, Husky. Amazon is no help. Thought I was paying more for better quality, but I guess I was just lining someone's pockets a little more. Disgusted.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Become friends with You tube and save some money!
customer_reviews.text: As stated, read the reviews. This is a great weedeater. Become friends with You tube and learn how to tune carburetor. Didn't idle or throttle up from the box. After watching a 10 minute video, runs like a champ. Will tackle anything the home owner puts in front of him.
customer_reviews.author: chaser

customer_reviews.title: Good Line Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these thus so far. One I had for 5 years and then something happened with the engine. I bought another and have had no trouble with the Husqvarna weed trimmer. It runs well and I get decent usage from the OEM head but after 2 years I have to put on a better head that carries a heavier line that lasts very well. I get on average 5 entire years of service and then something more expensive will break about the 5 years mark. Usually it is something that is more expensive to fix than replace. I wont buy anything else as its all cheap junk. Husqvarna all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Bucky Hunziker

customer_reviews.title: Weeds Lookout!  Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful weed-eater and I love the controls that allow for varied speeds. I haven't tried, but I think this could cut down a tree! The part that I haven't mastered (or is not so good in the design) is how the line works in installation and how it feeds. I think it's supposed to have a "bump" feeder, but it hasn't worked well at all. Loading the line is also a pain. So ... not happy with the line use and install. A more mechanical person than myself may have no problem and if so, this is a terrific machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: feeling bad I didn't buy it locally for 10 bucks more
customer_reviews.text: It needed adjustment from the local dealer immediatly on arrival, feeling bad I didn't buy it locally for 10 bucks more. Oh ya it sucks with the pole saw, it seems to starve for gas when inverted.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Bad parts. hard starts wont stay running
customer_reviews.text: Delivery took over 12 days but what do you expect for free shipping. We had a 65x110 lot we need to trim. Had a hard time getting to start. Had to leave it on full choke to keep going. If you dropped it to 1/2 or off it would die. After 9 days of very frustration start dies start go 12 feet dies. I final gave up. This thing is pure junk. I bought a $5 electric plug in one at a goodwill. put line in it and finish the lot in under 1 hour. Step it up Husquarna... side note.
customer_reviews.author: jerry martin

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the machine itself
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this week eater. I am happy with the machine itself, but the cutting head is a piece of junk straight out of the box. I have already replaced it with an after market head. I spoke with a friend of mine who had also recently purchased the same weed eater and he had already replaced the factory cutting head as well. I would expect more from Husqvarna that this. With the replacement cutting head, I have cut both light and heavy weeds without a single issue. Starts well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works with Trimmer Plus Attachments
customer_reviews.text: My main reason for purchase is b/c my trimmer plus attachments fit on the end. Would they work, I don't know. So I got it and YES the Trimmer Plus attachments works on it. I had a troybilt trimmer and after 4 years the upper part of the motor broke. A bolt sheared off and then the cast cracked. This was a home use trimmer. It should have lasted longer. So I wanted a more durable trimmer. I already had a ton of attachments for the troybilt and didn't want them to go to waste. So I went with this. The only thing I don't like is that the trimmer head spins counter clockwise. I am used to clock wise...
customer_reviews.author: K-Mac

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great the first season. The second season it would bog down a bit but still worked. Season three it is junk. Replaced, fuel filter, carburetor, Spark plug and still does not work. I would not recommend getting this brand as the product does not last. Customer service was horrible and I would not buy Husqvarna products again. The seller was good its the manufacturer I have an issue with.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: but works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is not your average weed eater. It will handle much more than the average lawn trimming. A little heavier than I was expecting, but works great!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and doesn't start
customer_reviews.text: Revised: took to repair center and they were able to start it. Really looking forward to this gas trimmer, purchased in December, tried using for the first time in March. Will NOT start. Mixed the 2.6 oz 2cc oil with 1 gallon of gas, primed (bulb has fuel) and followed the directions explicitly regarding the choke. Spark plug connected, etc. REALLY discouraging to think I have to take it into the service department when I haven't even used it. VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: David Brent

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We had to wait almost a month to receive and then wait for the strap we ordered. We have 5 acres and we needed a heavy duty gas string trimmer and Husqvarna is a great brand we know and is trusted. When my husband used it the first time, he commented that it is pretty heavy and when I asked him how it compared to his previous gas trimmer and he said "this thing is a brute and works great". He likes it and is satisfied but he said you really need a strap if you are going to do a big job because it is fairly heavy.
customer_reviews.author: cjwoman

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this thing ran like junk. It would not idle correctly and it basically had 2 speeds... Full throttle or stalled. It requires a special tool to adjust the carb that I don't have. So I took it to a official Husqvarna dealer for warrantee to get the carb adjusted and then they tried to rip me off too!!! This will be first and last Husqvarna product that I ever buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trimmer - no issues.
customer_reviews.text: For 200$ - my last unit lasted 7 years, even after I ran over the shaft with my tractor. I mistakenly used fuel without the oil mix and froze the piston- otherwise it was still running very strong!!! Has lots of power, easy to operate, and start. I used thicker cord, and the unit still cut great with no power loss. I have about 200 trees I trim around every other week - this trimmer did it all with ease...
customer_reviews.author: RUNTY 1

customer_reviews.title: It's temperamental and often doesn't start.
customer_reviews.text: This strimmer is temperamental. One day it will start the next it won't. I've only owned the unit for 8 weeks I've used it maybe 8 times and I only use premixed Husqvarna fuel in it. I have had other people try to start it and they can't get it to work either. I paid over $200 for it and am very disappointed and frustrated with it. I watched the Husqvarna video on how to start the machine. It worked once then went back to being difficult again. Anything this unreliable shouldn't be sold.
customer_reviews.author: celia buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Designed Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I use this weed trimmer to clear 2-3 foot tall grass and weeds. Probably way more than it was designed for - yet it handles tall and thick foliage well. My previous trimmer (different brand) clogged and bogged down. The Husqvarna punches above its weight. I also use a Husqvarna chain saw and like the trimmer, it is tough, and easy to use. Totally sold on Husqvarna products - they are durable, easy to use, perform better than expected. reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Hess

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: It was a little finicky to get started and get used to after having used an electric for years, but now that I'm used to it, it's great. Seems like it took a couple of uses to get broken in the point that it was easy to start, idle, and modulate engine speed. Loads of power makes jobs that were impossible with the electric downright easy. The string it comes with is not really enough to get started, go ahead and get more when you get this. Do not overfill the tank, because it will leak.
customer_reviews.author: JMA

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a number of weed eaters and they have all failed after a few years of use so this time, I decided I'd spend a bit more in hopes of getting a better-built product. I have not had this one long enough to comment on longevity but for now, it fires up instantly and it whacks weeds with incredible fury. Had the Spartans at Thermopylae been armed with a few of these, they won have defeated the Persians. Gets rare 5 stars from me because I'm hard to please.
customer_reviews.author: Hard T. PleaseTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Not too heave and the balance is great. Good on gas and not too loud
customer_reviews.text: I was so get up with a royobi trimmer I bought off here that I threw it as far as I could and ordered this. 100% improvement. It cuts through about anything too. Not too heave and the balance is great. Good on gas and not too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a little heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I seemed to be going through cheap weed eaters every year and finally I decided to try this one because I have a lawn mower in this brand that I’ve had for years that I love and have never had issues with. It’s still within the first year I’ve had this things but so far it’s great! After doing my 1/2 acre lawn, it is a bit heavy so I may add a strap somehow later but works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Fields

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer does NOT work and Amazon will NOT let you return it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer was easy to assemble and starts up fine, but it won't stay on. I used it for 20-30 min, but then it started bogging down. I let it cool down and tried it again, but it dies as soon as I hit the trigger to give it more gas. I have used weed whackers in the past and used the oil that came with it when mixing the gas/oil. I read some additional reviews and this appears to be a common issue. Don't make the same mistake I did. Find a good store near you that respects their customers and stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Froze up after minimal usage. Told by warranty dealer that the oil was wrong and that the warranty wouldn't honor it. Amazon won't take it back since it has had gas and oil in it. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Not such a great experience.
customer_reviews.text: I ran one tank before the motor seized. Good fuel. I've been running Husky chainsaws for almost 40 years. Thought Id go with the weed whacker. I would like to give this 5 stars as it worked great for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Updike

customer_reviews.title: Won't run after warm up.
customer_reviews.text: In general the shaft is too short for a person 6'-0" tall regardless of how it runs it is pretty uncomfortable to use. The engine started fine and ran well until warmed up. Once it is warmed up it bogs down when at full throttle. Makes the unit worthless to get anything done. It will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, easy to start and very versatile with different attachments
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer! It’s light, powerful, and most importantly starts very easily (my #1 pet peeve with lawn equipment). I’ve purchased an accessory to use with this to cut brush and small trees which really extends the utility of this far beyond a weed wacker. I’m looking forward to exploring other accessories as well. They click on and off easily and add a lot of value to this system. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ismail

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the exact same model I had previously bought about 10yrs ago. I still have it and it runs well, just wanted to leave it at my second home. It's a pretty good machine for the money. Great for the home owner.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan81

customer_reviews.title: Carburetor needs a bit of tweaking
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that other reviewers mentioned the necessity to tweak the carburetor, and I can confirm this is true. I live at around 4700 ft elevation, and out of the box the device's engine seemed to lugg a bit. After tweaking the carburetor with a 21 tooth carb tool it seems to be working great. It will need a 10 minute warmup time before you can take the choke off.
customer_reviews.author: M. Visnovsky

customer_reviews.title: If you take care of this model, it will keep working for you.  It's a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a good deal! We live in the country and this weedeater does a fantastic job on the weeds around out yard and property. This is the second one of this model we bought. After a year the first one is still doing the job, so we got another one for our son and he thinks it's a good deal too.
customer_reviews.author: Jone

customer_reviews.title: Operating instructions are simple and clear.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy and operating instructions were clear and simple.I was given a 'worx' wireless wire trimmer and very quickly realized it would not work out on my 1/3 acre. I cleared most of the area in the hour after I assembled this little 2 stroke trimmer. It's a lot louder, but it has a lot more torque and cutting power. Very quick setup, very good instructions, all I needed to add was measured gas. Came with 2 stroke oil and pre-installed head with trimmer line. Keen.
customer_reviews.author: imakesushi

customer_reviews.title: I thought when I brought a Husqvarna it would live up to its reputation, didn't happen!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Husqvarna 128LD trimmer for two months, used one tank of gas, now the trimmer stalls after cranking. After research, I find that it is a common problem that other buyers have with this model. Find another brand or model or you will regret it!!!
customer_reviews.author: THESWAN

customer_reviews.title: Great little cutter
customer_reviews.text: It is easy and predictable to start. Runs with plenty of power. Has reasonably good balance. Is a fast cutter. I like the clutch feature that allows it to idle without spinning the cutting head. But, my wife says it is very noisy, with an irritating sound. I, as the user, don't notice that.
customer_reviews.author: J Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of replacing Troy Built weed eaters every two years, so I decided to try a Husky. So far so good. I love the quick starting, the power of the unit and that I can use my existing attachments (edger, blower, etc.) from my previous purchases. I don't know if it will last longer than the Troy Built, but we'll see. Needless to say, I'm happy with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: fabiocat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with my unit and inability to reach Husqvarna
customer_reviews.text: The lower portion of the weed eater would not stay securely attached in place. If I ran into any obstruction or tapped the unit to advance the line, the lower unit would turn. I bought the unit last month, and used it twice. The most frustrating aspect of this was my inability to reach anyone at Husqvarna. I called two different numbers several times. I’d hold for 15 to 25 minutes, no rep ever picked up.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald White

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible! Will only run on half choke. I just bought it in the spring and it never ran right. And of course I'm outside the window for returns
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P.

customer_reviews.title: Best gas trimmer out  there.
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer starts very easily. It runs so nice,quite and smooth. It is very powerful and the string advances very nice. The only problem I have with it is gas leaking between the gas tank and gas cap when you don't keep it level.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Harry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I feel like a bad a*s when I am walking around with this thing, just shredding the gnar (or grass). I feel like my neighbors want to be me because of this weed wacker. Buy this and gain instant respect!
customer_reviews.author: Brennan Giuffre

customer_reviews.title: Great weed wacker. Terrible shipping job.
customer_reviews.text: Great weed wacker. Terrible shipping job. Box was wide open. Lucky for me the product was still inside.
customer_reviews.author: Abe Frohman

customer_reviews.title: Good but slow to rev sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Had bought a Husqvarna chainsaw which has been exceptional so went w/ H for weedeater also. Only complaint is seems to take a bit of time to get wound up. If you let off the gas to move or clear grass from the head it takes a while to rev it back to a level where it works. Once it is going wide open it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike R. Peek

customer_reviews.title: Keeps stalling
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. The cutter started stalling after 35 days. too bad I can't return.
customer_reviews.author: mohamad elfarran

customer_reviews.title: This ain't built to last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trimmer in July 2019 and by late October it was acting up. Tried to file for a warranty and Husqvarna will not hold up to their warranty. The trimmer is weak and underpowered. These were simply made to compete with the lower budget models that big box stores sell. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this trimmer. Go with another brand of orange trimmers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy start/simple to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to start and operate .very easy line change. however, this unit advertises additional options such as tiller attachment which can not be found anywhere.. that was a let down ..But for the money its a nice little weedwacker.
customer_reviews.author: The american

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the power of this trimmer given it's light weight. I mow and trim 5 acres every few weeks during the summer. This trimmer stands it's ground vs my echo and my stihl trimmers. My other trimmers have more power but they are not as light and maneuverable. I would buy this trimmer again.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: A great, powerful light weight trimmer
customer_reviews.text: A great, powerful light weight trimmer. It works with all of my old ryobi attachments. Very happy with this purchase. Most of my outdoor equipment is made my husqvarna and this is another winner. A quick note, I did have to adjust the idle after the first tank of fuel but it only takes about 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great after 3 or 4 minute carb adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Trims as fast as I can walk. Thick string cuts a long time before needing to be fed. I bought the carb tool for $5 on amazon when I bought the weed-eater. Opened the idle gas 3/4 turn the hi 1/4 turn and turned the idle speed up about 1.5 turns. Took 3 or 4 minutes to get it where I wanted it. Super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: although very powerful the human engineering and functionality is abysmal, and replacing the trimer line requires a great deal of effort and the ergonomics are terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Max T. Cat

customer_reviews.title: Brand new need carb adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t run right bogs down when I hit the throttle. Now I had to order carb adjusting kit. Brand new runs like crap out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works great and no issues
customer_reviews.text: I have had my weedeater for a little over a month now. It hasn't failed to start and runs like a champ. Pretty powerful and easy to run. At this point I am completely satisfied. I use the premixed, canned gas and that may be one reason I haven't had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great weed eater with add on attachments
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic machine. its really easy to get set up right out of the box. Easy to start and very powerful. the attachment options makes it a no brainer to buy this one. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and works great!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has to use this since I am disabled. For her it's easy to start and use. A bit on the heavy side but manageable. It should come with a shoulder strap. It only took a few minutes for me to assemble even in a wheelchair. Easy! Put gas in and go. It comes with some line already on the spool.
customer_reviews.author: MTOldtymer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful weed whacker, and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble out of the box (instructions about a using wing nut to attach the safety shroud is not accurate, but a bolt is used instead with the included allen wrench). Fueled up with the gas/oil mixture, primed the gas, FIRED UP ON THE SECOND PULL, and powered into trimming back tall weeds and grass very easily. Expecting years of use from this bad boy!
customer_reviews.author: VRS

customer_reviews.title: Need to show how to restring the spool
customer_reviews.text: The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because there's no instructions on how to put new line on the spool. The trimmer is easy to handle and use except for putting line back on it.
customer_reviews.author: jims

customer_reviews.title: Good on blackberries with blade.
customer_reviews.text: Using to clear 1/2 of blackberries with a blade attachment. Works great, plenty of power, starts easy and stays running. I've been through 12 tanks of fuel so far no worries. Went to a gator string with wire core....a must have for heavy weeds and works on young berries.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money, you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems twice stronger than the Craftsman or weed eater models I have used in the past. I got so tired of spending a half hour getting them to start. This thing starts up and is a POWERFUL cutter. I have Trimmer Plus attachments and Craftsman attachments. They all work on this and have power like never before. Buy this with confidence!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good
customer_reviews.text: The only thing we were disappointed with, as others have stated, was that the carb needs adjustment. It would be nice if that was done at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sunde

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This weed-whacking beast does the job! The nylon line used in this particular unit is very hardy and cuts through most vegetation without a problem. Spooling new line is fairly simple and the engine thus far has proven to be reliable and very easy to start.
customer_reviews.author: JPbluzharp

customer_reviews.title: Power
customer_reviews.text: I had to adjust the carb like so many said, and it ran so good after a little tweak. I wish it came with more string, as it ran out fast. Other than that it's a beast on weeds
customer_reviews.author: Dan87quest

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Very easy to start. Great performance from a great brand. Does come with starter oil for mixing and also line, all you need is gas.
customer_reviews.author: brooke

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is a madman. I've used it to clear acres of fields. Starts like new every time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged, quick ship came a day early. Works smoothly, lighter than the old weed wacker. Well made, nice design. Starts quickly. Nicest feature is the well designed string head, easy loading with no fumbling.
customer_reviews.author: 4u1solo

customer_reviews.title: " The Beast "
customer_reviews.text: Out of the Box I followed the easy instructions for start and it did. Remember to chok it properly as to instruct. Then be sure to wear eye protection because this thing has power and then some . I mean that it is not necessary to hold full throttle always , but when needed it can whack it's way to hell and back maybe ... This was with only 2 uses . let's see how it goes after time and in cooler weather. I have had 2 other Stihl weed wackers with strap and swing bar type. I think I made a purchase that got my money's worth ...
customer_reviews.author: Jon Blaze

customer_reviews.title: One of the bulkiest/heavy units ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I find this item heavier that my previous Craftsman 32cc weed eater, but by the time it was delivered the price had dropped by $24 , so now I am doubly unhappy. I refund for the difference is expected or I will return it and ask for a refund for the whole price and buy a Craftsman again.
customer_reviews.author: Guido A.

customer_reviews.title: What a little monster of a machine!
customer_reviews.text: This little monster is far better than i expected in this price range! Whether trimming lawn grass, or months old wild areas and weeds, it didn't slow down. Line replacement was simple and easy. Super impressed!
customer_reviews.author: tom garner

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trimmer - definitely worth every dollar. Cuts through tall grass like butter. Easy to start and no problems with stalling regardless of where it is used. Not your cheaply made trimmer, this baby is made to last.
customer_reviews.author: JayCee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Had some trouble the first day with it stopping but after it broke in, it worked very well. Chops through weeks like butter. Only gripe? A bit heavier than my Echo and the added weight does not seem to add any cutting function.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad A.

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer on the market for  the money!
customer_reviews.text: Used for 3 years now and it starts every time. Easy to spool and maintain! A little heavy but that comes with the territory! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Don R

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power, easy to start
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power for my residential use, and it starts very easily. The bump spool head doesn't work as well as I had expected, but it's easier than replacing pieces of line manually as I had done with my previous trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: P. Zampino

customer_reviews.title: Easy starting Weed Eating Monster.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised with how easy to start this product was and by it's superior performance for a residential weed eater. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer was able to cut through tall salt grass without added gas. The instructions on starting was printed and it started as instructed. The negative aspect was that small gas tank needed to be filled after 15 minutes of running time. The cutting string was strong and did not break on hitting sticks, and rocks.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Prime the pump a few times, one or two pulls and it starts right up. Easiest starting weed eater I've ever owned. I would recommend getting a strap when you purchase one of these. It makes whatever trimming you are doing so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J.

customer_reviews.title: Weeds didn’t know what hit them!
customer_reviews.text: This is a machine and a half. It’s not too heavy but if you are looking for lightweight this might not be for you. If you want something that takes no prisoners this is your machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Raymond

customer_reviews.title: So far it has worker great. Easy starting and handling
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worker great. Easy starting and handling. Made trimming yard much faster. Trimmed some fairly heavy duty vegetation around edges of the yard where our woods start.
customer_reviews.author: it's fun

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 128LD 17" Cutting Path Detachable Gas String Trimmer
product_meta.description:
Style:TrimmerThe best selling 128LD is your go to gas trimmer when you need a powerful and easy to use tool for grass, weeds and more. Our SmartStart trimmer technology reduces starter cord resistance by 40% to allow for easy engine starts and the strong, braided trimmer line is ready for work. A straight shaft design provides greater reach underneath bushes and those hard to reach spots. The trimmer is easy to store and transport thanks to the detachable head feature. Part of a smart multi-tool family, the 128LD string trimmer power base is compatible with three "click on" attachments - purchase the edger, cultivator and pole saw attachments to tackle multiple jobs in your yard.

AMAZON.COM
Lightweight yet powerful, the Husqvarna 128LD Trimmer lets you tackle yard work with ease. This multipurpose trimmer comes with an easy-loading T25 automatic trimmer head and boasts a strong braided wire cable drive. It's ideal for homeowners who want a straightforward, reliable tool to handle branch, brush, and lawn care. 

 


The 128LD Trimmer
At a Glance:  * Lightweight, multipurpose tool ideal for homeowner use
 * Detachable shaft for easy transport and storage
 * Stop switch automatically resets to "on" position for easy starting
 * Versatile cutting guard can be used with either grass blade or trimmer head
 * Strong braided wire cable drive


Lightweight, Hardworking Design
Weighing just 10.8 pounds, the 128LD is easy to handle and hold and includes a detachable shaft for easy transport and storage. Designed for moderate outdoor work, it gives you the freedom to quickly and easily tackle a range of jobs, from trimming hedges to clearing away excess branches.

Fast Starts
With the 128LD, you can start work right away without wasting time struggling to get the trimmer going. Its engine and starter are specially designed for quick starts with minimal effort. Air purge technology that removes air from the carburetor and fuel system, the Smart Start recoil system, an auto return stop switch that automatically resets to the "on" position, and a fuel pump all ensure that this trimmer is ready to go when you are.

Incredible Versatility
The trimmer gives you the freedom to take care of a range of tasks with one convenient, easy-to-use tool. Designed to be compatible with several attachments available as accessories , this trimmer can be customized to suit your year-round needs. It also features a versatile cutting attachment guard that can be used with either a grass blade or a trimmer head.

Husqvarna: Exceptional Products for Exceptional Yards
Great yards demand equipment that is as dedicated and hardworking as you are. Fortunately, Husqvarna's range of garden equipment offers everything from lawnmowers and snow blowers to trimmers and chainsaws that let you master your slice of the great outdoors. With Husqvarna, it's easy to make your yard the envy of the neighborhood.

What's in the Box
128LD Trimmer with T25 automatic trimmer head and manual.







FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Lightweight multi-purpose trimmer, perfect for homeowners. Easy starting with Smart Start recoil system and fuel pump. Strong, braided wire cable drive. Comes with easy loading T25 semi automatic trimmer head.

See more
feature_bullets: Features a 28cc 2-cycle engine which powers the 17 inch (cutting width) trimmer head
Trimmer engine runs on a mixture of unleaded gas and 2-cycle oil (2. 6 oz bottle is included, see bottle for mixing instructions)
Easily release new trimmer line as you work by tapping the trimmer head against the grass to activate the Tap 'N Go line release feature
Have no worries when it is time to replace the trimmer line - the T25 trimmer head is designed for simple and easy line reloading
A translucent fuel tank allows you to visually monitor your fuel level as you work
Conveniently remove unwanted air from the carburetor and fuel system using the air purge primer bulb
String trimmer is backed by a 2-year limited for residential use

Utilize the full potential of this tool with the optional attachments: the edger keeps your lawn, pathways and flower beds looking neat, with a clearly defined edge (952711607); the cultivator is great for tilling small areas in your yard like flower beds and beneath trees (952711608); the pole saw gives you extra reach when you need it for those hard to reach limbs (952711672)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,172 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
